subject: Catching Up
event:
I'm back from LA and the Emmy Awards, and as usual there's a zillion things to catch up on.

The Giants and Jets both won last weekend.  They both made it more exciting than it needed to be, of course, but a win is a win is a win, and I'll take them.  Life is magical and full of joy.

GAME OF THRONES also won big, as those of you who watched the Emmy telecast know.  Three more wins, for writing, directing, and show.  Added to the nine that we won last weekend, that's twelve, and gave GOT the record for most Emmys ever won by a primetime scripted series.  With thirty-eight, we edged past FRAZIER.  Congrats to all, and especially to Dan and Dave, who have put together a truly amazing team and made some television history in the process.

(I do wish our nominated actors and actresses had brought some gold home as well, though.  With two finalists in Best Supporting Actor, and three in Best Supporting Actress, we ended up dividing the vote and competing against ourselves, I fear.  But the performances we got from Peter, Kit, Lena, Maisie, and Emilia speaks for themselves, trophies notwithstanding).

Jimmy Kimmel did a great job as host.

For me, a couple of personal highlights were meeting Jim Kimmel, Jimmy's father, who is a big fan of GAMES, and getting the Emmy from Dennis Franz, an amazing actor whose work on NYPD BLUE remains some of the finest ever seen on television.  Best police show ever, imnsho).

There were great parties both before and after the awards themselves... though I fear I may getting too old for such things.  I turned sixty-eight on September 20th, and may have reached the age where I prefer quieter parties with comfortable chairs.  

And now I'm home, and there's more work to do.   Later, folks.

comments.article: You're awesome George!
Happy birthday George. Live long and prosper. Be prepared Winter is coming !!
I'm 27 in 3 days and I already prefer quieter parties with comfortable chairs.
Thought it's kinda late, but happy birthday from your fan in Egypt. wish that i could see you someday in egypt, i hope it will be peaceful productive year to enjoy  :)
comments.subject: HBD

comments.article: Happy belated Birthday!  Hope you had a wonderful day!
comments.subject: Happy Belated Birthday

comments.article: Glad you had a nice time. Also, Happy Birthday!

Happy Belated birthday. Was great to see you in attendance at the Emmy's. I too was disappointed that none of the actors won, but your idea about competing against each other makes a lot of sense.
They all our great, but would have loved to see Lena win one for all the great work she does each season. Even though Cersei isn't the most, emm, likable character she always does wonders in every scene she is involved in.
comments.subject: Happy Belated

comments.article:
Too old to party? Oh Bah humbug. I am 23 and I much prefer a comfortable chair and a nice small gathering with my most beloved.
I was extremely pleased Game Of Thrones won so many Emmys, especially Battle of the Bastards. Visually I feel it was one of the best on television.
Eagerly awaiting Winds of Winter though to be honest. Hope work goes well for you.
Belated  "happy birthday"  George!!!
comments.subject: HBD

comments.article: Glad you had fun! Love and admiration from Canada

Is the incredible purple Tesla going to be at the Concorso?

And, yeh, being 7 years older than you, I too appreciate parties with comfy chairs. Happy Birthday!

charley
comments.subject: Welcome home!

comments.article: Happy happy birthday! You are a gentleman and a scholar, ser.
comments.subject: Happy birthday!

comments.article:
GRR,

I look forward to seeing you happy and healthy at those events for many years hopefully well into your next HBO series as well as the Jets winning the Super Bowl. I am guessing another GRR HBO series is more likely to come in the near future though!

HBD and thanks for all the entertainment you have provided over the years!

Happy belated!
Frasier, huh? Tough, and we'll deserved.
Don't feel old, George. I'm only 28 and I prefer quieter parties too!
comments.subject: Comfy chairs

comments.article: Congratulations and happy birthday!

Soon you're going to have to add an awards room onto the house.

And a somewhat belated Happy Birthday.

An Emmy and both your teams winning! Pretty good birthday prezzies!
comments.subject: Congrats, George

comments.article:
The Wire is the best police show ever. For that matter, it's the best show ever, period.
: )
It is known.

comments.subject: Another year, another birthday, another Emmy

comments.article: George, I hope one day you see the error of your ways and renounce the Freys of football, the NY Giants, and join us gentlemen-scholars known as the Philadelphia Eagles. Winter playoffs are coming.
comments.subject: Giants

comments.article:
Hi, george, I'm a fan from Brazil.
Two years ago, I've suffered a pretty rough patch in my life, felt depressed, wanted desperately to kill myself. At the time, I was reading A Dance with Dragons for the first time. By the time I had finished, the book had not only cheered me up, but left me craving for more.
Then I realised I couldn't kill myself anymore. I needed to know what happened next. I needed Winds of Winter. Back then, it was the only thing I wanted. I said to myself:
I'll just wait for the two last books then I will be gone from this miserable earth, just 5 years tops and I'm out of here.
Your delay saved my life. Now I have many reasons to live for, Winds of Winter still being one of them, for sure.
Sounds weird, but I wanna thank you for taking so long to write.
Quite unusual feedback, huh?
Took as long as you want. I just want them to be good. I'll be waiting for them. Promise.
comments.subject: I've been meaning to tell you this

comments.article: It's not that unusual. George gave me a reason to live. Thank-you George hope you have many more birthdays.
comments.subject: RE: I've been meaning to tell you this
RE: I've been meaning to tell you this

comments.article: When I was told your Jets beat my hometown Bills, all I could think was "Oh, GRRM will be happy about that." Congratulations! Your team's victory, a birthday gift to you, is crafted from the tears of Buffalonians.
Heck I'm 25 and prefer quieter parties compared to ragers.
